intro: Oldenlandia tenella, commonly known as the slender spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its ornamental value and ability to spread via runners make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
